title: PowerShell MCP Tool Usage Examples & Patterns
body: PowerShell MCP Server tool usage examples: Basic safe commands - Get-ComputerInfo, Get-Process with filtering and sorting, Get-Date for system information gathering; Script execution - multi-line scripts with variables, WMI queries, calculated output formatting; Syntax validation - pre-flight PowerShell syntax checking without execution risk; Risky operations - file operations (Remove-Item, Copy-Item, Move-Item) require 'confirmed: true' parameter; Authentication - include 'key' parameter when server requires authentication; Timeouts - use 'timeout' parameter for long-running operations (default: 90 seconds), 'aiAgentTimeout' for AI agent-specific overrides; Working directory - use 'workingDirectory' parameter to set command execution context; File execution - execute .ps1 files with 'parameters' object for complex script arguments. All responses include success boolean, security assessment with level/risk/reason, execution time, and comprehensive error information.
